alert.note: Alert for Butler (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 29 at 9:34PM CDT until April 29 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL BUTLER AND WEST CENTRAL GREENWOOD COUNTIES... At 934 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 11 miles west of Eureka, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Butler and west central Greenwood Counties. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN
info.instruction: Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
